snippet: Lost amid the withered crops and dehydrated cattle that symbolize the most widespread drought in decades has been the toll on families that depend on farming.
abstract: Country's most widespread drought in decades takes its toll on families that depend on farming, threatening their way of life; adding to uncertainty is Congress's failure to pass a farm bill, leaving farmers without a safety net; nearly two-thirds of the continental United States is in a moderate to exceptional drought.

byline.contributor: Steven Yaccino contributed reporting from Chicago, and Ron Nixon from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Lost amid the withered crops and dehydrated cattle that symbolize the most widespread drought in decades has been the toll on families that depend on farming.

headline.seo: A Drought’s Toll on Farm Families
headline.main: Drought Leaves Cracks in Way of Life
